meanings.definition: A collective farm in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: The kolhoz provided a way for farmers to work together.
meanings.sent2: The villagers joined the kolhoz to cultivate the land collectively.
meanings.sent3: The kolhoz members decided to have a race to see who could harvest the most crops.
meanings.sent4: The kolhoz was a beacon of unity in the rural landscape.
meanings.sent5: The kolhoz hummed with the sounds of shared labor and community spirit.

meanings.definition: A type of agricultural cooperative in Russia and other former Soviet republics.
meanings.sent1: The local farmers formed a kolhoz to pool their resources.
meanings.sent2: The government supported the development of new kolhoz in the region.
meanings.sent3: The kolhoz members organized a potluck to celebrate a successful harvest.
meanings.sent4: The kolhoz symbolized the strength of collaboration among farmers.
meanings.sent5: The fields around the kolhoz flourished under the cooperative efforts of the farmers.
